definition: "Mr Science", phrase used during the May 4th Movement 五四運動|五四运动[Wu3 si4 Yun4 dong4]/abbr. for 賽因斯|赛因斯[sai4 yin1 si1]/see also 德先生[De2 xian1 sheng5]
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Hello Mr. Sai, Yes, I am very grateful to you.
sentences.chinese: 你好，赛先生，是的，我非常感激你。

sentences.english: Mr Wopsle's great-aunt kept an evening school in the village;
sentences.chinese: 沃甫赛先生的姑婆在村子里创办了一所夜校。

sentences.english: 'Of course I know it, 'answered poor Mr Wopsle.
sentences.chinese: “我当然知道，”可怜的伍甫赛先生回答。

sentences.english: These days, China is lavishing money on Mr.
sentences.chinese: 现在，中国正在慷慨投资于赛先生。

definition: "Mr Democracy", phrase used during the May 4th Movement 五四運動|五四运动[Wu3 si4 Yun4 dong4]/abbr. for 德謨克拉西|德谟克拉西[de2 mo2 ke4 la1 xi1]/see also 賽先生|赛先生[Sai4 xian1 sheng5]
Western learning (intellectual movement in the late Qing)/also called 洋務運動|洋务运动
pseudoscientist/crank/crackpot (abbr. for 民間科學家|民间科学家)
New Confucianism, a social and political movement founded in 1920s China that combines aspects of Western and Eastern philosophy/see also 當代新儒家|当代新儒家[Dang1 dai4 Xin1 Ru2 jia1]
